words.definition: A brook is a small stream.
words.example: Water flows down several brooks on the mountain.

words.definition: To cater to someone means to provide them with all the things needed or wanted.
words.example: The nurse catered to the sick man's needs.

words.definition: When someone is considerate, they pay attention to the needs of others.
words.example: The considerate boy gave a present to his girlfriend.

words.definition: The consumption of food or drink is the act of eating or drinking it.
words.example: These apples are too rotten for consumption.

words.definition: Criteria are the standards used to judge or decide something.
words.example: The school has high criteria for accepting new students.

words.definition: A crust is the hard outer part of something, such as bread.
words.example: He always cuts the crust off his sandwiches.

words.definition: To degrade someone means to cause people to feel they are no longer worthy of respect.
words.example: The boss degraded his employees by shouting at them in public.

words.definition: To entitle someone to something means to give them the right to have or do it.
words.example: His good performance entitled him to a promotion.

words.definition: To escort someone means to go with them as a guard or companion.
words.example: The police escorted the president to the airport.

words.definition: When something is external, it is on the outside or comes from the outside.
words.example: The external walls of the house were painted white.

words.definition: A facility is a building or service that is provided for a particular purpose.
words.example: The new sports facility has a swimming pool and a gym.

words.definition: A faculty is a mental or physical ability; it also refers to a group of university teachers.
words.example: She has a great faculty for learning languages.

words.definition: A heap is a large pile of things.
words.example: There was a heap of clothes on the floor.

words.definition: A hemisphere is one half of the Earth or a solid sphere.
words.example: The Northern Hemisphere is warmer in the summer.

words.definition: A hound is a type of dog that is used for hunting.
words.example: The hounds chased the fox through the woods.

words.definition: When something is impersonal, it lacks human feelings or warmth.
words.example: The hotel room was clean but very impersonal.

words.definition: An ornament is an object used for decoration.
words.example: She put some Christmas ornaments on the tree.

words.definition: A pedestrian is a person who is walking in a street or road.
words.example: The car stopped to let the pedestrians cross the road.

words.definition: A sanctuary is a place where people or animals are safe.
words.example: The bird sanctuary protects many rare species of birds.

words.definition: A spectator is a person who watches a sports event.
words.example: Thousands of spectators came to watch the football match.
